text:
This beer with the approved label that the supermarket COOP has agreed, has an interesting historical background. It is in fact made from the 3800 years old recipe as archeologists found along with the hymn to Ninkasi in the former Mesopotamia (now Iraq). Perhaps it is in fact the worlds first written beer receipt!
It has stable creamy foam and an aroma of grapes and lemon. Slight hint of honey adds a brief sweetness, before a slightly sour vinous flavor of the grapes takes over. This mixed with citrusy acidity makes it a very different ale, which certainly does not fall in with the expectation of Easter brew. I certainly imagined something else, but welcome the diversity of the beer market and the fact that I once fell over a wannabe-bock-imitation.
This is a beer that keeps what the description on the back label promises. It is delicious on its own and very special way. There will unfortunately probably be many who do not like it! It can remind a lot about Mystikale from the danish brewery Djævlebryg.
Bottle at home. Pours hazy dark amber, nose is caramel, raisins, taste is similar, light spice.
Oplysninger fundet på gammel note. Påskebrygsmagning 2012. Nr. 4 ud af 12 smagte med 19 point.

Bottle at the Pre-Zwanze tasting. Big thanks to Leighton. Aroma is sweet caramel / toffee and cake. Hazed caramel red colour with a summy white head. Flavour is apricot / peach slightly sweet. Slight oxidation.

Bottle thanks to Leighton at the Pre-Zwanze tasting. It pours clear amber with a medium beige head. The nose is sweet, caramel, fruit cake, light tang, meatiness and earth. The taste is toast, raisin, cherry jam, prune, hay, light alcohol, oxidized notes and wood with a dry finish. Medium+ body and fine carbonation. Interesting. Pretty decent.

50cl bottle at Bruces, thanks to Leighton. It pours a clear red colour with a small off white head . Aroma is sweet with caramel an toffee with red berries. Taste is sweet with dried fruits, plum and raisins. Full bodied with good carboantion. Overall, very good.

Bottle at the Pre-Zwanze tasting - London. Between one and two years old - or so. Pours lightly hazy russet with a fine, creamy head. Nose has some meaty fruits, bread, light tang. Medium sweet flavor, subtle toffee, light spices, suggestions of age. Medium bodied with fine, creamy carbonation. Sweet finish, more bread, some caramel, low bitterness, ripe fruits. Interesting and tasty.

Draught at Fermentoren. Very cloudy orange-amber with lace. Murky. Honey nose, with orange, some oxidation, minerals. Flavor is of citrus honey, sweet at first, then drying out nicely. Orange, honey, and mineral finish. Light body, clean and crisp. Quite nice, with good, dry, fruity honey.
A nice fruite bitterness with a creamy mouthfeel. Dark amber in color with white head.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen (Beer Here tap takeover) -   Hazy amber gold with off-white head. Very punchy strong citrus hop notes here with a sweet caramel malt base. Good bitter finish, great easter ale this.

Sample from 50 cl. bottle. Hazy, golden-amber colour with a small, off-white head. Sweet aroma with grapes, honey and bread/caramel malts, citrus hops. Sweet taste. Medium body, creamy texture. Finishes bitter with citrus hops and a good amount of caramel malts. Very nice Easter beer.

Flaske 0,5l, flot lidt uklar øl med hvid skum. Humlet duft, blød med en lidt skarp afslutning, med tør humlet eftersmag. En fornøjelse

Free Føroyar!!!

A really good påske-beer, that is only missing in appearance. Great aroma and taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rødgylden klar skum hvid lidt 
Citrus lime korn 
Bitter modrate sød lidt 
Vandede tær livlig 
26/3-13

50 cl bottle @ Olutravintola Konttori. Rated on 24.04.2009
Aroma is quite hoppy with pine needles, resin, some caramel and hints of berries. Flavour is also rather hoppy with resin, some toffee, fruits, pine needles and hints of hay. Also some disturbing element I find hard to describe. Not sure which part of this is traditional, felt like an IPA (or amber ale).
Pours dark copper. Aroma is very sweet and toffee flavoured. Flavour is milder on the toffee than expected but very interested
light, pretty easy-drinking. Not what I would call real grape flavor but rather a pleasant fruity note in the background.

Bottle 500ml @ home
Pours cloudy orange/amber with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, honey and fruits. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

500ml bottle. Pours hazy into the glass with a bold dark amber almost red colour and carries an even layer of foam. Pleasant malt and butterscotch aroma with similar flavours. Strong in the mouth with good body and texture.

Enjoyed at Schouskjelleren, from tap i think. 
Hazy orange in color, frothy offwhite head. 
Strong aroma of floral hops, grapefruit/mango, honey, yeast. Taste of caramel, orange, mango, honey. Good body and not too much carbonation, great bitterness. Very good beer.
Gott påsköl med smak av malt, humle, lite brödig och smak av belgisk jäst och honungstoner.
DØEs ölfestival, København 2012: Tyvärr ganska blaskig, lite maltig och mycket tråkig.

Draught @ Ølfestival København 2012.
Pours a deep copper colour with a white head. Aroma of toasted malts, nuts and dried fruits. Flavour of toasted malts, sweet fruits, some spices and honey. Low bitterness. Medium bodied, soft carbonation and a sweet honey-like finish. Decent traditional ale.

Draught @ Ølfestival Kobenhavn.
Pours hazy golden color with small head. Aroma of grass, mild hoppy fruits and malts. Flavor of malts, fruits and dry hay. Quite straightforward, smooth and creamy palate.
4414

0.5l bottle from beermerchants.com Since its Good Friday and all, I suppose its suitable with an Easter brew. This one pours a light blurry almost glowing amber-orange body with a small quite bubbly off-white head. The aroma has yeasty, malty and a bit of alcohol tones, continues with some fruity and sweet hints. The texture on this one is light watery and it has a soft to average carbonation level. In the flavor I get hints of heather honey, its sweet but it also has a mild acidity. The flavors just seems like they are not blended, and they all go in their own directions. It ends light astringent and watery with a strange light sour-ish aftertaste. Not sure what I think of it as a Easter beer, but the whole bottle went down the good old stomach quite quickly, so I guess you can say that its quite light drinkable. 06.04.2012

UPDATED: APR 9, 2012 50 cl bottle @ home. Pours dark amber with decent sized off-white head that fairly quickly fades. Aroma is quite malty with some fruit as well as a little hint of booze. Flavour is malty and fruity with a very subdued slightly bitter hoppy finish.

500 ml bottle. Copenhagen, Denmark.
This is a bit unorthodox rating since I enjoyed this from the bottle in the park in sunny Copenhagen listening live music. Aroma is quite typical Danish Påskeøl aroma. Malt, hops, bread and Belgian yeasty notes in kind of nasty aroma. Flavour is quite similar. Hefty hoppiness. Some honey sweetness. Unfortunately I didnt enjoyed that much.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours amber with a sticky off white head. Nice lacing left about. Nose is hoppier than expected. Hoppy with sweet and subtle belgian influence. I get a weird, but pleasing wine/grape note. Comes through in the taste as well. Wine/grapes with honey and light fruits. A littlew sweet and a touch of booze at the back end with very soft carbonation. Nice and solid beer
light hoppy and bread aroma,amber, hazy, off white foam, light body, oily feel, lively, light bitter finish.
Molto luppolata! Un pò mattarella! Si sente anche un pò di fichi. Il Cristo sulletichetta potrebbe turbare i credenti, ma spacca di brutto. Soggettivamente (sempre!) è piaciuta moltissimo. Provatela

tap Fermentoren. 2012 version. Pours hazy golden orange , Aroma: grassy notes , malty , fruity, dusty, grapes, caramel , earthy , some plantlike qualities, melon, grain, floral, Taste: quite malty , some fatty notes, very balanced , light acidity, malty, fruity, tangerine, orange peel, light Minerals , floral notes, light grassy notes , red berries, White grapes, caramel. great, considering the style.

From a bottle. Pours hazy dark amber with thin white head. Aroma is nice but fairly unexciting, caramel, toffee and raisins. Similar taste with a hint of spice. Quite sweet on the palate and slow to finish. Quite nice but not particularly exciting
Pours dark amber with an off-white head. Aroma is caramel, peach and citrus. Flavour is caramel, peach, grapefruit, citrus and tropical fruit.

Hazy brown, lively carbonation. Fruit, some sourness, honey, yeast. 
Quite complex, short finish.
It might be authentic and similar to ancient brews, but it does not conveince me totally.
Fortunately not much honey and grape flavor as it says on the label. But this is a really good Easter beer.
50cl, new Danish brew Anno 2009, with honey and wine grapes, thx to Jeppe!, complex brew, spicy and fruity, balanced, cloudy, small head, good Easter brew, yet expensive

from erzbierschof.ch - hazy amber beer with an aroma of marzipan and caramel; full-bodied and gently sirupy, sweet and bitter with a fair carbonation, long malty caramelish aftertaste with lingering hoppy notes - balanced

50cl bottle, many thanks to Martin & Gry. Poured a reddish-brown with not much head, aromas of sweet malt, alcohol, a little orange and some red fruit, then on the palate a warming blend of a rich sweet honeyed and fruity body, matched with a good alcohol kick and soft carbonation. Finally there is a lightly bitter finish with hints of fruitcake, wine and peppery hops. A little sweeter than I normally like, but interestingly complex.
Sampler at CBF 2011-05-26. Clear orange with an off-white rim. Toasted, malty and mildly hoppy aroma. Hoppy, sweet caramel mouth. Medium to full. Alcoholic and syrupy. Unbalanced.
On tap @ Copenhagen Beer Festival. Clear amber body, small white head. Nose is dark malts, hints of red berries and caramel. Taste is roasted malts, caramel and hints of yeast. A bit plain but nice.

Etwas hopfiger Antrunk  mit minimalen Fruchtnoten, die sofort weichen, um dem Hopfen Platz zu machen. Trocken, etwas grasig, Süffig, insgesamt abseits des Hopfens wenig aromatisch.Dafür wird der Hopfen angenehm aromatisch, daneben zeichnen sich leichte Getreidenoten ab. Nettes Bier ohne Besonderheiten. Insbesondere die mitgebrauten Trauben sind nicht zu schmecken. Wenn man es weiß zeigt sich wenigstens der Honig zu Beginn. 9/9/8/8/10/9

500mL bottle.  Pours clear golden brown with a very small head that quickly disappears.  Aroma of honey, citrus and wood, not strong but quite clean.  Theres a slight hint of the honey that went into it in the flavour, medium sweetness, low bitterness, a little acidic fruitiness but overall the flavours are quite subtle.  The complexity of the flavours increases as it warms  Light-medium bodied, soft carbonation and a drying fruity wine-like finish.
Ottima birra. Sapore di uva e datteri, bevibile e frizzantina. Giusto equilibrio tra lattacco dolciastro e la nota amara in retrogusto.

Hazy amber beer with very faint white foam. Sweetish aromawhere especially the malt and honey come through. Fresh flavor, rather mild in its expression. A fine underlying acidity balances the sweetness of the honey and the grapes. Very subtle beer. Semi-dry finish.

Rating #523, bottle at Easter Brew Tasting 11  

Looking forward to this one as Im a former archaeology student... unclear  yellow-brown beer, nice head. Aroma is quite IPA-like; flowers, hops, strawberries. Wonder if the sumerians, or however old this recipe is, had this amount of raw material for each brew. It was probably brewed as some kind of mead and diluted, but what do I know. Flavour is sweet and nice, blackcurrant, hops, only a distant touch of grapes if any at all. Soft, medium palate. All in all really enjoyable.

On tap at Plan B, Copenhagen in April 2011. 

Hazy copper with a medium beige head. Malt, fruit, caramel, strawberries and some "tutti-frutti". Sweet but very drinkable. I liked this one a lot.
nose is sweet grape, little leaves, hoppy bite, then sweet again, feel is medium broad, carb is medium with small bubbles, taste is iron, little soap, sweet grape and elegant hops finish
Bottle. Somewhat hazy orange/amber beer with a decent offwhite head. Fruity malty aroma. Malty flavor, fruity, quite boring.

Bottled. Thx rlgk
Hazy amber. Small tan head.
Hair-salon-aroma. and some sweet fruits.
Some sweet fruitiness in the flavour. Sweet and malty.

Hazy glowing orange with a white head. Aroma is sweet, very fruity, caramel and moderate hoppy - grapefruit and pine. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and bitter finish. The honey gets lost in all the general fruitiness. 070411
Bärnstensfärgad dimmig vätska med lågt skum. Syrligt frisk doft av jäst, syrliga druvor och gräsig humle. Svårplacerad smak.  Söt, besk, jästig, sträv, tjock. Bra balans.
Beer tasting 10 cl. Dark golden pour with an off-white head. Aroma of hops and fruit. Taste and aftertaste is moderately bitter

Bottle @ Home. Pours dark orange with a small creamy offwhite head. Aroma is fruity hops, grapes and abit of pepper. Taste is sweet malt, caramel, fruity hops with sweet apples, melon, kiwi, grapefruit, grapes and light spices to. Medium body, low carbonation. Nice brew. 060211

Bottle at a tasting 15th of January 2011. Pours amber, with a small off white head. Hoppy aroma, mostly pine, with some tropical fruit. Taste is quite tropical, with grass and pine following. The alcohol is well disguised, with a lightly bitter finish.

Pours hazy dark amber/ruby with a large but quickly fading head.
Nose shows lots of sweet malt and hops. Plenty of caramel and nutty malt mixed with tropical fruit, herbal and peppery hops, light honey and soft alcohol. Very nice, somewhat unusual.
Flavours are quite different with the hop profile showing only pungent herbal and spicy notes rather than any fruit. Not as sweet either although theres some nice bready malt. Alcohol is quite pronounced perhaps due to the honey.
Nice creamy mouthfeel, moderate carbonation.

Small head misty orange brown pour aroma honey caramel fruit flavour grapefruit caramel malt seems very sweet toffee alcohol shows up strange bitter very rigid tasting ale not too keen on the label either

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy brownish amber with a short, foamy white head that quickly shrinks to a ring around the surface. Sweet, spicy, hoppy aroma with notes of honey, orange, lemon and pine needles. Grapes are a little more noticeable in the flavour, imparting a distinct riesling character, as well as hints of juniper, grapefruit, caramel, oak, lime and spices. Light bodied with a dry mouthfeel and moderate carbonation and a lengthy spicy, bitter finish. Very interesting, complex beer, probably not something I would drink all the time, but great for a change of pace and quite refreshing too.
Draught at KØ10. Mild grassy hop aroma. Cloudy dark orange colour. Very small creamy white head. Grassy flavour. Slightly grainy in the finish.
6th May 2010. Copenhagen Beer Festival. Amber beer, quite hazy. No head. Dry crisp palate. A little toffee malt. A little piney grapefruit hop. Slightly spicy. Dry finish.

0.5 L bottle picked [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, København.  Two fingers of dense blond foam upon a clear, reddish amber body. Hoppy up front.  Resin, citrus-zest and tropical. Followed by a scent of toasted malts and cream-caramel. Taste is hop driven. Pine and resin at first, then some fruitiness.  Restrained malts, fairly dry, with a fine sweetness below. Medium full. Alcohol is noticable.  Fruity hops linger in the finish. Beer Here is reliable, as always. (An extra on apperance for the label design)
bottle at johnys ...copper ... big sweet hop nose ...  sweet fruity hops ... pine and lime hop resins  ... tasty

Draught. Amber coloured. Unclear. Light brown head. Citrus, herbs, honey and yeast in the aroma. Flavour is full of berries, yeast, grape and some vague flowers and a touch of honey. Medium to full bodied. Fruity light bitter end.
Draught (Plan B, Copenhagen) - Hazy amber in colour. Peach and hops in the aroma. Toffee and grapefruit in the taste. Nicely balanced.

Bottle. Pours a nice amber colour with a slight off white head. Aroma is very fruity with notes of hops, tropcial frutis, citrus and malts. Flavors is very sweet and tart, with alot of fruits. I taste tropical fruits like mango, the grapes aswell, grapefruit, slight floral and piney note, some malts, and just the slightest amount of honey. Finishes with a nice hoppy taste. Not any trace of alcohol, even though it is on 7 ABV. The body is medium to full and is fairly dry. Overall a very good and refreshing spring beer, and it is probably my favorite danish easter beer!

Draught at Carlsens Kvarter, Odense. Slight hazy copper coloured with a nice small dense and lasting off white head. Very fruity aroma with notes of resin, citrus, yeast and berries. Flavours of fruit, caramel and crisp and bitter finish. Awesome brew!

A Mes rate. Bottle at home.Clean orange amber with a thin off white head. Obvious honey and grapes but not over powering. Fruity and yeasty, decent bitterness and some slight dusty notes from the honey. Well integrated and nicely crafted all round as expected from such a great brewer. Nice and clean mouthfeel yet still plenty juicy. Good lengthy bitterness in the finish. Jolly nice stuff.

From the Bottle at the GBBF, Earls Court 07/08/2009 (Thanks to ChristianScheffel)
Big fruit and hop aroma. Golden coloured strong in alcohol a little hazy in appearance and hoppy with a crisp dry and slightly bitter finish.

Bottle at GBBF 2009 thanks to ChristianScheffel.  Hazy copper colour, thin beige head.  Hops.  Bit sweet, but with lots of fruit.  Strawberry and kiwi fruits in mouth.  I love this brewer, Christian ex of Olfabrikken.  Some good malts too, which are a bit toasty.

Sampled from a bottle that turned up at our rating table in Earls Court Exhibition Centre. Courtesy of ChristianScheffel. Hazy, golden body with a beige, solid foam stand. Very fresh and inviting aroma of berries and fruits. Initial taste of tropical fruits and sappy oranges giving way to succulent grapes and mild hints of honey sweetness. Rounded bittering hops to a long-lived ending. Appetising smooth in the mouth. A skilful made living product with a refreshing drinkability (London, 07.08.2009).

Bottle.Amber beige head.Very hoppy profile on the aroma ,kinda piny and sweet. Somewhat bitter with hops dominating the brew ,citrus and pine.Nice malty sweetness.I also missed the honey and grapes .But a very nice beer ,all the same.

500. Thanks, Maria! Wow, this is a cool one. Christian is serious about producing good beer, there can be no doubt. Pours slightly hazy burnished light amber withy golden overtones. Huge thick rocky head with bits of loose lacing up the side. Sweet piney nose, almost like a beautiful fresh APA, Creamy medium body with firm carb. Nice toasty, nutty caramel mid-palate with nice mild piney bitterness balancing it out. Slight dry grape notes on the finish. Labels just as cute as two buttons, and the beers actually good enough to get me thinking positive thoughts about easter beers. Nicely done.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2009 Bottle. A golden, slightly hazy beer wtih a beige head of moderate size. Resiny nose with malts and caramel sweetness. Sweet, citrusy flavor with orange-peel and maltyness, and a fine bitterness. Full-bodied and nicely carbonated. Smooth bitterness at the end, getting quite resiny after a while. Both honey and alcohol are well hidden in this one, and I dont think the grapes left much of themselves either. At least not except for fermentables. Pretty nice beer anyway. 090619

Bottle, 50cl. Pours an unclear golden beer with a dense offwhite head. The aroma is hoppy with fruity and berries. The flavor is bitter with lots of berries and fruit. The palate is fresh, and overall it is a good beer.

Bottle (cellphone rating). Amber with an off white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and fruity. The flavour is quite fruity with a honey sweetness to it. Very nice and interesting. I know I have more notes somewhere...now to find them...
bottle. Dark golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is hop, malt, pine. Flavour is sweet, pine , orange peel, malt, yeast. Nice beer.

Bottle. Pours a hazy, golden amber with a big, fluffy beige/yellowish head. Great lacing. Sweetish grape fruit aroma. Very nice. Malt mucking about in the background. Slight notes of melon. Flavour is sweetish grape fruit with melon notes. Sweetish finish with a sweet liquorice bitterness  weird for a light beer, but it works here. Grape fruit and melon notes as well. Overall not a very complex beer  its mostly about the grape fruit notes, but I like that. Also, the liquorice had me surprised, but it worked well. 24-07-09.
Bottle. Pours a clear amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty hoppy aroma with some hints of grape. Fruity malty hoppy grapefruit flavor. Has a fruity malty hoppy finish.
Orange colored brew. Very hoppy aroma. Flavor is hops all over the place too. Fruits, pine, some malts. Nice one.

Bottle. Plenty of hops, grass and fruits in aroma. Golden amber colour with soft beige head. Complex flavour of honey, fruits, grapes and distinct hops bitterness. Long lasting bitter and slightly sweet aftertaste.
Clear golden with a medium off white head. Hoppy aroma with malty and pine notes. Flavour was hoppy with pine, grapefruit and  malty notes. Finished bitter.
Bottled, thx to thewolf. Clear amber color, short head. Aroma of honey, floral hop, slight malt. Bit sweet taste, decent bitterness. Pretty good stuff.

Bottled. Tnx thewolf! Aroma is very fruity and has melon, aprikots. Hazy, orange coloured beer with an off-white head. The taste is bitter, has some smooth maltiness and a lot of fruits again. Bit oily. Medium-full bodied beer. Very enjoyable.
Bottle, 50 cl. Very strange beer. Unclear orange colour. Flavor is fruity hops, citrus and very strange.
Bottle. Unclear orange colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour malt, hops, fruit and yeast.

Bottle. Hazy orange colour with an off-white head. Aroma: Fruity and lightly hoppy aroma, also some grapes. Creamy, fruity, bitter, medium malty, a bit metallic, lightly sourish. Not that interesting, Unnecessary high ABV.

Bottle 50cl. @ home.Unclear medium orange color with a average, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy hoppy, orange, fruity - mango / grape. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and heavy bitter with a long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20090326]

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Nordic, Tampere. Pinkish amber colour, small beige creamy head. Aroma is grapes, fruity hops and mild yeastyness. Flavour is strong caramel malts, grapes, tropical fruits and mild honeyish notes. As the beer gets warmer the honey gets more obvious.
Golden coloured and hazy. Light orange coloured head, fully lasting.Nice aroma, fruity, sweet and dry hoppy, metallic. Flavor starts sweet and finish heavy bitter. Dry texture.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are nice honey, rich hops and flowers, some fruits and malt. Wonderful balance between honey and hops.
Bottle. Amber body, with a large off-while head. Aroma is fruity hops, citrus and grape. Flavor is fruity hops, citrus and grape. Nice brew.
Amber with fine white head. Nice citrus aroma with spicenotes. Flavor indeed of grapes, pines and flowers. Good beer and great labelstory!!

Bottled (Pikkulintu, BB 08/2009). 
Clear deep amber color, off-white creamy head. Pine, kiwi or mango ... very fruity aroma. Also some barnyard! Tropical fruity, some mango, pine, grapefruit, finish has hoppy bitterness, dry aftertaste. Some yeast notes. Reminds me about Beer Hunters Mufloni NZPA.

500ml bottle (Olutkellari, Helsinki)
Tangerine aroma. Tangerine taste. Lovely at first, with all that fruity hoppiness. However, the extreme citrussy hop formula really isnt that inventive, and I feel like Ive had this one before. Covered 7% well.
Beige lasting head. Heavily hopped traditional ale - spicy and crisp - grape like. Resin and fruit. long lingering taste. Lovely.

Bottle. Large creamy off-white lasting head. Cloudy amber-orange body. Nice aroma. Very hoppy - flowers, perfume, citrus and lemon. A nice vine, vanilla beginning. Oily texture, lively texture and a metallic bitter finish. Moderate sweet, light acid and heavy bitter. Fruity and delicious hoppy.
Pours amber wih a beige head. Nose of flowery hops and honey. Flavour of malt, honey, mild hops and then it must be grapes. Medium bodied. Fair bitter finish. Very interesting and enjoyable.

Bottle. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Amber colour. Light malty and heavy hoppy aroma. Rasin ans pine notes. Fresh citrus/orange flavor notes. Moderate bitter. Long nice moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate. Great special tasting beer.

Wauw this is different.
Beautiful orange colour with lasting white head.
A lot of petrol-like minerality that I only know from aged rieslings (and like white wines).
You can really tell the grapes in the smell and taste. The more beer-like qualities are not as overwhelming, but overall a very good easter beer.

Bottle at home.
Hazy amber with a large off-white head. Aroma moderate malty (caramel), moderate to heavy hoppy (flowery). Flavor moderate sweet, heavy bitetr. Medium to full body.

Bottle - Amber body with a huuuge off white head, no sparkle; Huge nose with tons of hops, great but could be more refined, both honey with a spicy touch and grape with some peel aromas; Huge soft body that should have more carbonation, quite thick from honey (a little to thick); Long big finish with lots of hop aromas and a strange but pleasant and interesting spicy touch on the front of the tongue. Great beer,  but could be a little more fresh and have a little more carbonation.

(Bottle at Pikkulintu, Helsinki, on 2009-04-04, shared with sayravai, isos and mto -- thanks!) Brown with hints of orange and hazy. Small white head. Pine and hops in aroma. Full bodied and dry palate with medium carbonation. Malts, pine, bitterness, fruitiness and grapefruit in taste. Bitter and fruity aftertaste.

(Bottled) Very hazy amber with a small, lasting head. Strongly pine-resiny-hoppy aroma with juniper hints and berryish maltiness. Flavor is also very pine-resiny, with citric hops, some yeast, and toffee-caramely malt. Medium body with lowish carbonation. A pleasantly hoppy, crisp and balanced easter brew.

Aroma lot of hops. Tastes hops. Lot of hops? Not ipa but hops. Great

Bottle. great beer. Amber colour with medium offwhite head.  Aroma some citrus hopps and sweet grapes. Very nice and different from other beers. Taste again hoppy and some taste of grapes as well. Very fresh. A dangerous beer if it wasn´t for the ABV, it could be drunk as a session beer. Very original and nice.

Fantastic! Hazy sleightly amber with a medium white head. Incredible aroma! Loads of pine and fresh leaves mixed with sweet exotic fruity notes of mandarine and mango, lovely!  Flavor not as intense, but thats alright, makes it refreshin overall. Its bitter with a fruity sweetness and end up quite dry.

From Superbrugsen, Aarhus, DK.
Bottled, 280309.
Golden with white head. Aroma of hop spices and fruit. Flavor is citrus, malt and delicate grape note.

Bottle. Pours straw yellow with a firm lasting white head. Very intense aroma of hops, grapey fruityness, honey notes and a touch of candied oranges.
Very lively on the palate and finishes refreshingly dry. This is a very interesting and really good beer.
Hazy amber colour with medium white head.Aroma is hoppy and fruity with flavor of pine and oranges,not much of honey and greaps but still a nice taste,feels bitter and dry.

(on bottle) A very indulging aroma of frsh hops, wooden barrel, leaves, hay; both solid and refreshing at the same time. Golden orange colr, nice white head. The taste itself was kind o´weird and not for this tounge. Starts out wth a malted, yet highly hopped beer, but later sips bring more and more gummybear-, grape-, sutfortaste to mind. In the end it´s a very sour/tast mouthfeel and this is not balanced with a solid maltiness, resulting in a sweet, rather sour, hopped ale, going here there and everywhere.

Bottle. Bit hazy body with a creamy longlasting off-white head. Hoppy and very fruity aroma. Pine, grass, peach and caramel. Flavour is grassy hops, caramel and fresh fruit. I also catch some undefinable thing that could be the grapes. Its medium bodied. It ends up very bitter and fruity. Great brew.

Flaske: Flot orange øl med et stort skumhoved. Duften er humlet med en lille snert af druerne. Smagen er afbalanceret humlet, men sent slår druerne til og gør den snerpende tør. Yderst delikat, men gør at den ikke er drikbar i store mængder. Meget original og spændende.

Bottle at home.
Hazy orange coloured with a huge off white head.
Fruity aroma of hops, pine needles and grass.
Fruity flavour opf grass, hops and pine needles.
Hoppy finish.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2009 Bottle at Lars. Pours an almost clear amber with an off-white head. Smells of strawberries. Sweet and quite hoppy. Fruity hops aromas. Aromas of strawberries. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Mellow bitter finish with more strawberries. Strawberry fields forever!

It is hazy, dark orange-golden with a huge, creamy head. The aroma has notes of fruity hops, flower, grapes, honey, yeast and hints of mead. The flavour has sweetness and aromatic notes of fruity hops, a lot of grapes, honey and the finish has a slightly dry bitterness. It is a very interesting beer indeed, and I like it.

Cloudy copper with a lasting white head. Archeologists will be disappointed, hopheads will rejoice: The aroma of this "4000 years old recipe" beer is American hops. Strong orange with peach and pine notes. Dare I day BeerHere house aroma? 
Dry and hoppy, really not that far removed from the Christmas IPA. Which was outstanding...
Honey and grapes are prominent on the label, but less so in the beer itself. I can live with that, and I think this is a really tasty IPAish beer. I had had it with lamb chops for the sake of Easter tradition, and it doesnt add much. Just a tasty beer in itself...
Unclear amber of color with a beige foamy head. An aroma of hops, grainy, fruits and citrus. A bitter flavor with sweet malt, hops, sweets, grapefruit, citrus and a dry finish.

50cl bottle @ Kvickly. Pours hazy copper with a creamy white head and lacings. Nose has a lot of varied & exotic fruity hops such as citrus, mango, peach, orange, flowers. Some sweet honey and grapefruit as well. Dry, crisp and fruity flavor with a whiff of caramel. Medium bodied. Very fine & pleasant!

Mango yellow head over pale amber ale. C-hops, mandarine, amazingly clear nose and ultimately inviting. Rather sharp, very citrussy flavours, both peel & juice, hops to the fore. Background sweetness. A bit light in body, served a tad too warm, but still nice, and no doubt refreshing. A very hoppy Easter to you, Christian!  Thanks to Carlo!

Bottle at home (Bought in Kvickly, spinderiet - 26 kr.) - shared with Mette. Clear red/brown - white head. Nice malty, lovely hoppy, grass, piney, light sparkling, lemon, grape, lots of grape, abricot, nice bitterness, light honey, orange, fruity, nutty, light chocolate... and something very nice that I cant place. Very nice and pleasant.

Bottle, bought @ Kvickly, Odense.
Pours hazy copper-golden with a nice, creamy, small, yellowish head. Super aroma, lots of grapes, good hops, strawberries, caramel. Medium carbonation, nice creamy mouthfeel Flavour has light grapes, malts, honey and a good dose of hops. Light dryness in the finish. Elegant and very drinkable.

Bottle. High creamy and lasting off-white head leaving nice lacings. Fruity aroma of oranges and honey. Sweet fruity honey nutty lemon oranges grape flavor with some bitterness as well. Low carbonation. Long aftertaste.

Bottled. A hazy amber beer with a light tan head. The aroma is sweet spicy hoppy - is it Amarillo? as well as lighter notes of honey and grapes. The flavor is sweet matly with notes of caramel, straw, dust, honey, and wine. The body is thin as if there is a very low level of residual sugar.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2009 Bottle. Kvickly dkr. 24,-  Cloudy amber golden colour with beige head. Aroma and taste of fruit, honey, hops and then a bit more fruit. Sweet and fruity mouthfeel and some dry hops in the finish. Not so traditional ale I Think..

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2011 2011-06-10, draught at Plan B, Copenhagen, 6-4-7-3-13=33Red-amber color, cloudy. Strange beer: a mild Pale Ale (but of reasonable quality) with an interesting, subtle, grape profile (Muscatel et al.), but also a light sourness that, I wonder, may be unwanted.2009-02-20, bottle, courtesy of Engelsmann, 7-4-8-5-16=40Hazy amber color. Big head. Strange peculiar aroma, its hoppy, grassy, dry, with grapefruit, sweat, artificial grapefruit aroma. Medium body but smooth mouthfeel, sweetish malt, with a hopping that plays completely with grapefruit. Very good!

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2009 50 cl bottle, bought at Havnens Vin & Tobakshus, Vejle. Shared with Roger in a hotel room in Aalborg. Amber color, fine off-white head. Aroma is very hoppy, with fruit and sweetness from, I guess, the grapes and the honey. Flavor is sweet (from the grapes and the honey - also the malt), hoppy, fruity. Very fine, sweet aftertaste, and moderate dry. Very interesting - and nice - beer! I´m proud to be the first Norwegian rating Beer Here. The four other BH-beers are waiting for me at Ølbutikken in Copenhagen;-)

Bottle 50 cl. Courtesy of Hildigöltur. Slightly hazy amber golden with a nice, off-white head. Very fresh hop aroma - an almost exotic fruitiness. Medium body, lightly fruity aroma but completely dominated by the dry hop accents. Ends fairly bitter. 190209

Botella. Cloudy deep goldenorange-brown colour. Lovely pine citrus hoppy aroma indeed. Very good mouthfeel. The flavour is soft with ripe fruits, fresh pine, pleasant bitterness and sweet ripe fruits. Long lasting pine and fruity bitter hoppy finish. Funny cheering chicking on the label. Great Easter brew indeed!

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2009 50 cl courtesy of ungstrup

aroma is  fresh and fruity, flowery real nice.
appears as yespr says as i sampled a bottle.
flavor is  the best easter beer i ever tasted. fruity, yeasty, fresh. strong. based witn oranges but never too sweet. flavor could not be much better.  case styudy in lots of flavor without trhe ABV intefering. great, great, brew.

50 cL bottle, courtesy of Ungstrup. Pours slight unclear golden orange to brown with a small off-white and semi creamy head. Dense citrusy and grapefruity hops aroma, yet also smooth. Smooth caramel malty base with a distinct floral hops flavour on top. Good balance between the sweet caramel malt and bitterness and fruity flavours of the hops. Ends dry and floral. Lovely Easter brew.
